result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keaton D Lowry

defendant.name: Lowry, Keaton D

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 19, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

(9:57 AM cases 19CF1090, 22CF809 called.) Defendant Keaton D Lowry in court. Attorney Christopher Wilhelm in court for Keaton D Lowry. Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements.
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas to both counts, which the Court receives.
Court orders 20 days for filing of motions which can be extended for good cause.
Attorney Wilhelm advises is working towards a global resolution with the State and requests about 6-8 weeks.
Status Conference in 22CF809 and Order to Show Cause in 19CF1090 scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 1:30 pm (15 minutes) in person.

9:30 AM cases 19CF1090, 22CF809 called. Defendant Keaton D Lowry in court.  Attorney Christopher Wilhelm in court for Keaton D Lowry.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
In 22CF809: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Both files referred to Branch 2 to schedule an OTSCH and an ARGN.

Conditions:
No contact with P.D. or his family and residence.

(11:29 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Keaton D Lowry appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Clayton Cavanaugh Law Intern, supervised by Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared by video for Keaton D Lowry. 
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint and waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on August 8, 2022 at 2:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with P.D. or his family and residence.
